intro: Phyllanthus carvalhoi, commonly known as the Brazilian spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and smooth, succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its structure includes a short stem with alternate leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Phyllanthus carvalhoi is also noted for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and its use in traditional medicine.
